results.title: The Argentine ant
results.brief_description: This film describes the methods used by State and Municipal authorities and C.S.I.R.O. to eradicate the Argentine Ant in large suburban and city areas. The efforts of individual householders to eradicate the pest have proved unsuccessful. The film shows, in detail, the large scale methods developed by the C.S.I.R.O. which have been used systematically and methodically in attempting to eradicate the pest.

results.title: Archival prints
results.brief_description:
1. Where the River Kiewa Flows - Focuses on the Kiewa Butter Factory and how it is using excess skim and butter milk to provide food for its piggery. By doing this it is increasing its profits and reducing waste. The Victorian Department of Agriculture’s ‘Pig Expert’ devised a plan for maximum efficiency of the piggery, taking into account that there would be more excess milk in the summer than the winter.

Contains footage of the Kiewa piggery as well as the butter production plant and surrounding district, which all look good.

  1. The Challenge - Film carries an inspirational message and is largely concerned with the need for all Victorians to consolidate their current strong agricultural position by embracing ‘progress’ and moving forward with new ideas. Very earnest throughout.

Opens with dissolves between Melbourne cityscapes and then focuses on numerous, well-shot general agricultural and farm scenes from the late 1950s. This includes shots of wheat farming, grain export, livestock and the people behind it.

Last shots are of Melbourne. The final one being a pan, shot from above, down St Kilda Rd away from the city, towards the Shrine of Rememberance.

Excellent titles/the end.

results.title: Archival prints
results.brief_description:
1. The Herringbone Milking Shed - Details the ‘new’ Herringbone Milking Shed, which can improve dramatically the speed in which cows can be milked. Good shots of previous cow-milking techniques, featuring nice colour and framing. Amusing stop-frame animation of how the shed works using toy cows.

With Herringbone Shed, 54 cows can be milked in 45 minutes, pre-mechanised milking could only manage 8 cows per hour. 6 minutes.

  1. Living Like Pigs - Begins with a comical example of how not to keep pigs and then gives numerous examples of how to keep pigs correctly. This includes footage of early piggery automation techniques, as well as more traditional pig care solutions. Contains many shots of pigs drinking milk in different types of pig pens. Nice colour and framing throughout. Good ‘The End’.

  2. Exit T.B - Largely about the importance of Tuberculosis eradication in Victoria. Shows the test undertaken to determine whether a cow has T.B and then what occures to the cow if it does (it is killed). Gives examples of different parts of a cow once infected by T.B. Then goes to show various milk products that are exported overseas and the importance of eradicating T.B so that more products can be exported. Good titles/’The End’.

  3. Poultry Industry Review - Begins with chicks being hatched and sorted into ‘males’ and ‘females’. Shows how battery hens are kept and then focsuses on an egg packing plant and the technology behind it. Good footage of lots of different machinery mainly concerned with extracting the raw egg from the shell. Shows how ‘eating’ chickens are prepared for sale and dressed, then focuses on turkeys and ducks. Fantastic shots of hundreds of Turkeys in a pen and an odd turkey de-feathering machine. Well-edited montage at end featuring chickens, eggs, ducks and turkeys. Good ‘The End’.

results.title: 1957 Pig Carcase Competition
results.brief_description: Details and promotes the 1957 Pig Carcase competition as well as pork production in Victoria as a whole. Similar to the 1955 Pig Carcase competition in format and style. Includes various shots of carcases being cut for display, general crowd shots, an awards ceremony and a speech by an official. Features fantastic footage of three carcases hanging up in front of a black backdrop being inspected and caressed by a man. Nice theatrical quality to it. Excellent shot of a boy inspecting pork shot from behind, highlighting very cute jeans. End of piece features an official from the Board of Meat, aided by illustrations, talking about how pork production in Victoria has improved over time. Behind him hang carcases and behind them there is a red wall. He wears a pink and red tie. This creates a quirky, very good-looking frame of man, meat and pig illustration. Soundtrack features music of the period and earnest narration about ‘pig raisers’.

results.title: 30 Seconds to go
results.brief_description:
Shot at a Mildura television station. Details how an episode of ‘On the Land’ is broadcast by inter-cutting between an installment of the programme and conventional ‘behind the scenes’ footage of a television studio. This includes shots of a camera operator, the television station’s studio, vision-switching and so on.

Actual ‘On the Land’ programme featured, contains information on good seeds to sow and non-hormonal spraying techniques. Contains exterior shots of an orchid.

Film opens with exterior shots of Mildura that begin at river and then move into more general street scenes. This lasts for two minutes.

results.title: 16mm Prints
results.brief_description:
1. Granville Cattle Shoot - Unedited footage of bulldozers and men clearing land in order to create pens to house cattle. Cattle is then shot in the head and picked-up by a bulldozer/tractor that dumps the dead, or close to dead body in a pit with other bloodied carcases. The pit of dead cows is then filled with soil.

  2. Mice Milking - Documents the process in which scientists at Dandenong milk mice with special machinery. The milk is then given to the American Cancer Council who use it to research cancer treatment. A mouse attached to the milking machine looks quite bizarre. One mouse yeilds a third of a teaspoon of milk per milking session. Good footage of the machine in action.

  3. The problem of Lamb Survival - Shows how the Department of Agriculture is trying to improve the amount of lambs that are born each year and survive to adulthood. Includes footage of a mobile laboratory in the field.

  4. N.A.S.A moon shots - Filmed photographs of general space imagery, focusing on the moon and spacecraft. Contains photograph or earth from space.

  5. Eclipse 23/10/76’ - Rushes of countryside, sheep and cars in the day and at night.

  5. Eclipse 23/10/76’ - Rushes of countryside, sheep and cars in the day and at night.
description_for_label:
1. Granville Cattle Shoot - Unedited footage of bulldozers and men clearing land in order to create pens to house cattle. Cattle is then shot in the head and picked-up by a bulldozer/tractor that dumps the dead, or close to dead body in a pit with other bloodied carcases. The pit of dead cows is then filled with soil.

  2. Mice Milking - Documents the process in which scientists at Dandenong milk mice with special machinery. The milk is then given to the American Cancer Council who use it to research cancer treatment. A mouse attached to the milking machine looks quite bizarre. One mouse yeilds a third of a teaspoon of milk per milking session. Good footage of the machine in action.

  3. The problem of Lamb Survival - Shows how the Department of Agriculture is trying to improve the amount of lambs that are born each year and survive to adulthood. Includes footage of a mobile laboratory in the field.

  4. N.A.S.A moon shots - Filmed photographs of general space imagery, focusing on the moon and spacecraft. Contains photograph or earth from space.

  5. Eclipse 23/10/76’ - Rushes of countryside, sheep and cars in the day and at night.

results.title: The Lion King: Simba's Mighty Adventure [computer game]
results.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge, plastic cartridge case, registration card, consumer information booklet and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description:
Simba’s Mighty Adventure is based on Disney’s The Lion King as well as it’s direct-to-video sequel Simba’s Pride. The game consists of ten side-scrolling levels: The first six are set in The Lion King and the rest in Simba’s Pride, with some levels ending in boss fights. The game tracks along with the plot of both films and follows Simba as he grows up. Key events, such as the stampede from the first film, make up their own levels. Simba moves by running, jumping and climbing. Jumping can also be used to defeat the snakes, spiders, or monkeys that get in Simba’s way. He can also swipe at them with his claw or, as an adult, roar at them to make them flee.

Aiding Simba in his journey are collectibles that grant extra lives, refill or extend Simba’s health or fill a special amulet. Collecting all five parts of the amulet grants an extra life and opens up a mini-game that can be played main menu. The game also has a mulitplayer element. Using a Gameboy Colour link cable with another player opens up an extramode where each player has to hold onto a star for as long as possible by avoiding the opposing player’s attacks.

results.title: Krazy Ivan [computer game]
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD jewel case, manual and registration card in cardboard box
results.brief_description:
Aliens have invaded the earth, raised energy generators that are slowly engulfing the planet and have imprisoned humans in robots. The only person who can stop them is Russian Commander Ivan Popovich and his Steel Cossack, a battle-ready powersuit.

In this 3D first person arcade shooter, the player must destroy the five energy generators by defeating the aliens defending it while simultaneously freeing any humans in the process. Rescuing humans gives the player resources that can be used to upgrade the Steel Cossack.

results.title: KKND 2: Krush Kill 'N Destroy Krossfire [computer game]
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM and CD jewel case with insert
results.brief_description: The battle for Earth rages on in the bleak world of KKnD2: Krossfire. The Survivors and Mutes from the previous game are joined by a new enemy: the Series 9. The Series 9 are a robot faction with origins in farm machinery. The radiation from mankind’s wars has warped their programming and they’ve taken up arms against the two original factions, who have destroyed the crops that they were designed to care for. As with the prior games, this game’s focus is resource management, base building, researching upgrades and the creation of units to defeat the other factions.
